name: UIKit
subtitle: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS or tvOS app.

items.name: About App Development with UIKit
items.subtitle: Learn about the basic support that UIKit and Xcode provide for your iOS and tvOS apps.

items.name: Protecting the User’s Privacy
items.subtitle: Secure personal data, and respect user preferences for how data is used.

items.name: Requesting Access to Protected Resources
items.subtitle: Provide a purpose string that explains to the user why you need access to protected resources.

items.name: Encrypting Your App’s Files
items.subtitle: Protect the user’s data in iOS by encrypting it on disk.

topics.name: App Structure
topics.desc: UIKit manages your app's interactions with the system and provides classes for you to manage your app's data and resources.

items.name: App and Environment
items.subtitle: Manage life-cycle events and your app’s UI scenes, and get information about traits and the environment in which your app runs.

items.name: Managing Your App's Life Cycle
items.subtitle: Respond to system notifications when your app is in the foreground or background, and handle other significant system-related events.

items.name: Responding to Memory Warnings
items.subtitle: Free up memory when asked to do so by the system.

items.name: Responding to the Launch of Your App
items.subtitle: Initialize your app’s data structures, prepare your app to run, and respond to any launch-time requests from the system.

items.name: About the App Launch Sequence
items.subtitle: Learn the order in which your custom code is executed at launch time.

items.name: Performing One-Time Setup for Your App
items.subtitle: Ensure that your app environment is properly configured.

items.name: Preserving Your App's UI Across Launches
items.subtitle: Return your app to its previous state after it is terminated by the system.

items.name: About the UI Preservation Process
items.subtitle: Learn how to customize the UIKit state preservation process.

items.name: About the UI Restoration Process
items.subtitle: Learn how to customize the UIKit state restoration process.

items.name: UIApplication
items.subtitle: The centralized point of control and coordination for apps running in iOS.

items.name: UIApplicationDelegate
items.subtitle: A set of methods that you use to manage shared behaviors for your app.

items.name: Scenes
items.subtitle: Manage multiple instances of your app’s UI simultaneously, and direct resources to the appropriate instance of your UI.
